Key Match Events: The Yankees scored their only runs via a first-inning groundout with a runner on third, and later in the sixth when Aaron Judge stole third and scored on a throwing error by catcher Christian Bethancourt.
Pre-Game Insights: Cubs manager Craig Counsell repeated 'it's not an excuse' twice when discussing the offense-suppressing elements.
Post-Match Reflections: Cubs president of baseball operations Jed Hoyer said 'it's a complicated season to figure out from the offensive standpoint.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The environment at the Friendly Confines has not been very friendly this season, with Wrigley Field having a 93 ballpark factor, ranking 29th among the 30 MLB venues in terms of offensive environment.
Others: The Cubs have scored 15 runs total in five games -- a dozen coming in the no-hitter on Wednesday -- with three shutout losses.
